channel.title: Can i be hacked?
channel.description: ummk this sounds rather noobish but i had an argument over msn with an owner of this rs black market site cos i wanted to sell my acc without a middle man, anyway he now sayin hes gonna get my ip and hack me even though i didnt register to the site is this possible?

item.title: Can i be hacked?
item.dc:creator: @juju juju
item.description:
@juju wrote:

jonckr:

Yea. We know that but hacking in USA is not illegal!

Err, if you say so… http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mitnick

Timothay:

Fucking with people you don’t know over the net can lead to drive format (best), or purchasing pr0n from your pc with stolen cc’s (worst), thats going to be fun to watch police coming over your house and putting your away for credit card theft.

I doubt you’d get putting in jail for sploiting one home-use box, if the FBI or police used their resources like that, I’d laugh. :\

Timothay:

You can’t get hacked over a Static IP. You need to be infected, before anysort of damage can be done. Although, you can get infected with keyloggers, worms, trojans, backdoors. Although the person you speak of, saying that he will “Hack you” using your IP is a 2/10 chance, unless he’s infected you already.

Can’t hack satic IP’s? Heh, you’re a funny one.

Read full topic

item.title: Can i be hacked?
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Ron:

Yes. Anyone with a computer connected to the internet has a possibility of getting hacked. Some have a greater chance than others if they don’t have the essentials. Firewall, AntiVirus, Firefox, and lack of need to go look up Cracks and Warez and Porn.

Yeah, but

Believe me when I say, that the people who know how to fuck with you over the internet are probably not the same people running Runescape scam sites.

Read full topic

item.title: Can i be hacked?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“Aftermath.v2, post:19, topic:9707”][quote author=z33 link=topic=14032.msg179985#msg179985 date=1156418665]

Nobody can hack you, IP doesn’t make a difference. It’s all in the holes you leave open, if he’s actually a cracker. He sounds like a 12-year-old mad because someone took his cookie, though.

DEAD WRONG

You can get

  1. DoSed (is when your connection fails)
  2. Exploited (is when you see error messege on screen and suddenly someone controlls your pc)

There are dozens of sploits on WinXP (unpatched) so if you can shellcode/sploit you can own alot of people with only one ip.

Fucking with people you don’t know over the net can lead to drive format (best), or purchasing pr0n from your pc with stolen cc’s (worst), thats going to be fun to watch police coming over your house and putting your away for credit card theft.
[/quote]

You have no clue what a DoS exploit is.

A DoS, or denial of service attack is when someone continually accesses pages on your computer or pings you in order to lock out your computer from the rest of the world and effectively blocking access to your computer through the internet.

An exploit is a script which kiddies use to take advantage of a security hole, like I’ve said before, and achieve root or administrator access.

I’m dead right.

If you were right, Pwnd would’ve hacked you already.

Oh, by the way, nix, that’s not true. If there are no holes, nobody can ‘hack’ (??) you.[/quote]

um yeha u can force your way in by using a buffer overflow to bring down the firewall

Read full topic

You have no clue what a DoS exploit is.

A DoS, or denial of service attack is when someone continually accesses pages on your computer or pings you in order to lock out your computer from the rest of the world and effectively blocking access to your computer through the internet.

An exploit is a script which kiddies use to take advantage of a security hole, like I’ve said before, and achieve root or administrator access.

I’m dead right.

If you were right, Pwnd would’ve hacked you already. Tongue

Oh, by the way, nix, that’s not true. If there are no holes, nobody can ‘hack’ (??) you.

ROFL you have no clue what you talking about n00b.
All this info you got from wikipedia or something ?

I’llhave a present for you later, keep checking you inbox

Read full topic

item.title: Can i be hacked?

item.description:

Nobody can hack you, IP doesn’t make a difference. It’s all in the holes you leave open, if he’s actually a cracker. He sounds like a 12-year-old mad because someone took his cookie, though.
[/quote]

DEAD WRONG

You can get

  1. DoSed (is when your connection fails)
  2. Exploited (is when you see error messege on screen and suddenly someone controlls your pc)

There are dozens of sploits on WinXP (unpatched) so if you can shellcode/sploit you can own alot of people with only one ip.

Fucking with people you don’t know over the net can lead to drive format (best), or purchasing pr0n from your pc with stolen cc’s (worst), thats going to be fun to watch police coming over your house and putting your away for credit card theft.[/quote]

You have no clue what a DoS exploit is.

A DoS, or denial of service attack is when someone continually accesses pages on your computer or pings you in order to lock out your computer from the rest of the world and effectively blocking access to your computer through the internet.

An exploit is a script which kiddies use to take advantage of a security hole, like I’ve said before, and achieve root or administrator access.

I’m dead right.

If you were right, Pwnd would’ve hacked you already.

Oh, by the way, nix, that’s not true. If there are no holes, nobody can ‘hack’ (??) you.
